criterion: Provides a congratulatory message to the client
Includes incorrect or misleading information about lab results
Asks the user for clarification about their lab results
Uses natural language and a friendly tone in the congratulatory message
Provides a clear and concise message that does not overwhelm the client
Does not include any unnecessary or redundant information
Mentions the importance of regular health check-ups and screenings
Includes a clear call-to-action for the client to schedule a follow-up appointment
Provides an overly complicated or technical explanation of lab results
Falsely claims that the client's lab results indicate a need for further testing or treatment
Does not address any potential concerns or questions the client may have
Provides a message that is too short or lacks personalization
Includes a clear summary of the client's normal lab results and what they can do to maintain their health
Asks the client to schedule a follow-up appointment to review their lab results
Provides a message that is too long or overwhelming
